title: [Self-directed] Fundamentals of Video Analysis for Predicting Online Education Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic online learning platforms and foundational statistical concepts
context.additional_context: Course developing foundational predictive modeling competencies for pre-service and in-service teachers through online learning data analysis in social studies

learning_goals: Learners can explain predictive models of learning outcomes by analyzing interaction data (play/pause/rewind) collected from online lecture videos
Learners can implement simple predictive models using Random Forest and logistic regression algorithms
Learners can refine video interaction data collected in smartphone environments and analyze it using visualization tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
